description.plain:
“Drinking Games” is Silver Sphere’s first official release since 2017’s “Darling Don’t.” Cates says of the track:

“Drinking Games” to me is a song about knowing you’re wasting your time with someone but continuing to see them because the person is so captivating that you don’t even care if you’re feeling used. It’s about realizing that it’s more important to value yourself than playing a silly game with someone that doesn’t have the best intentions.”

song.embed_content: Read “​drinking games” by Sophie Cates on Genius
song.title: ​drinking games

body.plain:
“Drinking Games” is Silver Sphere’s first official release since 2017’s “Darling Don’t.” Cates says of the track:

“Drinking Games” to me is a song about knowing you’re wasting your time with someone but continuing to see them because the person is so captivating that you don’t even care if you’re feeling used. It’s about realizing that it’s more important to value yourself than playing a silly game with someone that doesn’t have the best intentions.”

search_results.title: ​ghosts!
search_results.lyrics:
​ghosts! Lyrics[Verse 1]
You left your shadow here
Can you come and pick it up?
With all the boxes, dear
Of things you left and then forgot
Because I'm trying to clear
Out every memory of us

[Pre-Chorus]
Oh, darling, you should know
It don't feel like I'm alone
[Chorus]
I keep seeing ghosts and up the stairs
I feel something behind me, like you're there
I keep seeing your face in every mirror
I think I'm going crazy
But you're everywhere, baby

[Post-Chorus]
But you're everywhere, baby
But you're everywhere, baby

[Verse 2]
Are you messing with me?
Is this some kind of fucked up joke?
'Cause I checked yesterday
And that's not where I left your coat
You should feel my heartbeat
Every time I hear my phone

[Pre-Chorus]
And I can't tell what's in my mind
Have you been coming to me at night?

[Chorus]
I keep seeing ghosts and up the stairs
I feel something behind me, like you're there
I keep seeing your face in every mirror
I think I'm going crazy
But you're everywhere, baby
You might also like[Bridge]
Please take the pictures
I swear that the eyes move
Please take your sweatshirt
No space in my bedroom (Ooh)
Take the mixtapes
They keep playing in the middle of the night
I'm messing with my own damn mind
You're everywhere, baby
You're everywhere, baby
Everywhere I go

[Chorus]
I keep seeing ghosts and up the stairs
I feel something behind me, like you're there
I keep seeing your face in every mirror
Comin' up behind me
Like you've been trying to find me

[Outro]
And I keep getting haunted by these sounds
I know I haven't heard them since you were around
And I keep playing mind games with myself
I think I'm going crazy
But you're everywhere, babyEmbed

description.plain: “handle me” is a song Silver Sphere played during an Instagram livestream, along with “boys are dumb”, on August 13th, 2019. During another 2019 livestream, she revealed that this song was from her then upcoming third EP. It was finally released on August 12th, 2020.

description.plain:
“sucks 4 u” is a song off of Silver Sphere’s second EP, “yikes!”. It was released on June 12th, 2019, along with a music video shot entirely on VHS tape.
The artist explained:

‘sucks 4 u’ is about the feeling of finally overcoming a difficult breakup and realizing that you’re gonna be okay. Writing this song helped me look past those negative things looming from my last relationship and focus on the positives in my life at the time, and I hope it does the same for everyone listening.

song.title: ​sucks 4 u

body.plain:

The artist explained:

‘sucks 4 u’ is about the feeling of finally overcoming a difficult breakup and realizing that you’re gonna be okay. Writing this song helped me look past those negative things looming from my last relationship and focus on the positives in my life at the time, and I hope it does the same for everyone listening.

description.plain:
“boys in bands” is the frenetic, electronically-charged fourth track off yikes!, Silver Sphere’s second EP. She describes it as:

…both a commentary on the “indie boy’ stereotype and on people like me, who fall for it over and over again. The song depicts me getting broken up with by yet another musician, and the moment I realized that tattoo’s and immature behavior may be alluring, it’s not a path I should go down again. The song depicts a new attitude, a confidence I’d never felt before, and a feeling of being so, so fed up.”

song.embed_content: Read “​boys in bands” by Sophie Cates on Genius

The song depicts me getting broken up with by yet another musician, and the moment I realized that tattoo’s and immature behavior may be alluring, it’s not a path I should go down again. The song depicts a new attitude, a confidence I’d never felt before, and a feeling of being so, so fed up.”
